H3068.meaning: From הָיָה (hayah), to be. YHWH = He is / I AM (Ex 3:14). The tetragrammaton; covenant name of God.
H3068.significance: The name God gives Israel; the name by which he is known in covenant. I AM WHO I AM—being, presence, faithfulness. Name above every name until the Son bears it (Phil 2:9–11).

H4872.meaning: Hebrew מֹשֶׁה (Moshe); Egyptian element—“drawn out” (Ex 2:10). Possibly also Hebrew מָשָׁה (mashah), draw out.
H4872.significance: Deliverer and lawgiver; type of Christ as prophet (Deut 18:15) and mediator. Drawn out of the water—Israel drawn out of Egypt. His face shone (Ex 34:29); the law’s glory points to the greater Prophet.

H3478.meaning: From שָׂרָה (sarah), strive, + אֵל (el), God. Israel = he strives with God (Gen 32:28). New name for Jacob after wrestling at Peniel.
H3478.significance: Covenant name of the people; prince with God. The one who strove and prevailed becomes the nation that bears the promise. Type of the church as the true Israel (Rom 9:6).

H3290.meaning: From עָקַב (aqav), heel, take by the heel. Jacob = supplanter. Son of Isaac; twin of Esau (Gen 25:26).
H3290.significance: Grasped Esau’s heel; later wrestles God and becomes Israel (Gen 32:28). Father of the twelve tribes. Type of the chosen line—grace over merit; the younger receives the blessing.

H3327.meaning: From צָחַק (tsachaq), laugh. Isaac = he laughs (Gen 21:3, 6). Son of Abraham and Sarah.
H3327.significance: Son of promise; type of Christ as the offered son (Gen 22; Heb 11:17–19). Laughter of disbelief (Sarah) becomes laughter of joy. The seed through whom the covenant runs.

H1732.meaning: From דּוֹד (dod), beloved, or root דָּוִד (David). David = beloved. Second king of Israel (1 Sam 16:13).
H1732.significance: King after God’s heart (1 Sam 13:14); type of Christ as king (2 Sam 7; Luke 1:32). Shepherd, psalmist, covenant recipient. His line endures forever.

H8010.meaning: From שָׁלוֹם (shalom), peace. Solomon = peaceable. Son of David; king of Israel (1 Ki 1:39).
H8010.significance: Builder of the temple; wisdom and peace (1 Ki 4:24–25). Type of the peaceful reign; his fall (1 Ki 11) shows the need for a greater Son of David.

H3091.meaning: From יְהוֹשֻׁעַ (Yehoshua); יָהּ (Yah) + יָשַׁע (yasha), save. Joshua = YHWH saves. Successor of Moses (Num 27:18).
H3091.significance: Leads Israel into the land; type of Christ as captain of salvation (Heb 2:10). Same name as Jesus (Greek form). The Lord saves—in conquest and in gospel.

H4442.meaning: From מֶלֶךְ (melek), king, + צֶדֶק (tzedek), righteousness. Melchizedek = king of righteousness. Priest-king of Salem (Gen 14:18).
H4442.significance: Without genealogy (Heb 7:3); blesses Abraham, receives tithes. Type of Christ as priest forever after the order of Melchizedek (Ps 110:4; Heb 7).

H3130.meaning: From יָסַף (yasaf), add, increase. Joseph = may he add. Son of Jacob; sold into Egypt (Gen 37:28).
H3130.significance: Type of Christ in suffering and exaltation (Gen 37–50). Rejected by brothers, exalted to the right hand of Pharaoh; saves the nations. “God has made me forget” (Gen 41:51)—sorrow turned to fruitfulness.

H7354.meaning: From רָחֵל (rachel), ewe. Rachel = ewe. Wife of Jacob; mother of Joseph and Benjamin (Gen 29–35).
H7354.significance: Beloved of Jacob; wept for children (Jer 31:15; Matt 2:18). Her tomb marks the way; her sons become the chief tribes. Type of the bride and of maternal grief.

H5146.meaning: From נוֹחַ (Noach), rest. Noah = rest. Son of Lamech; preserved through the flood (Gen 6–9).
H5146.significance: Preacher of righteousness (2 Pet 2:5); type of salvation and new creation. The ark as type of Christ—refuge from judgment. Covenant of the bow (Gen 9:13).

H8035.meaning: From שֵׁם (shem), name. Shem = name. Son of Noah (Gen 5:32); brother of Ham and Japheth.
H8035.significance: Line of the covenant (Gen 9:26–27); blessed of the Lord. Father of the Semitic peoples; in his line comes Abraham and the promise.

H3389.meaning: Hebrew יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם (Yerushalayim); possibly foundation of peace or teaching of peace. Capital of Judah; city of the great King.
H3389.significance: City of David; site of the temple. Where the Lord chose to put his name (Deut 12:11). Type of the heavenly Jerusalem (Heb 12:22; Rev 21:2).

H0894.meaning: From בָּלַל (balal), confound. Babel/Babylon = confusion (Gen 11:9). Mesopotamian empire; later symbol of worldly power (Rev 17–18).
H0894.significance: Tower of Babel—man’s rebellion and scattering (Gen 11). Worldly kingdom; man’s substitute for God’s rule. Type of the city that opposes the Lamb.

H2332.meaning: From חָוָה (chawah), live, or חַי (chay), life. Eve = life. First woman; mother of all living (Gen 3:20).
H2332.significance: Taken from Adam; mother of Cain, Abel, Seth. Deceived (1 Tim 2:14) yet given the promise of the seed (Gen 3:15). Type of the church as bride.

H7014.meaning: From קָנָה (qanah), acquire, get. Cain = acquisition. Firstborn of Adam (Gen 4:1).
H7014.significance: Offered unacceptable sacrifice; slew Abel (Gen 4:8). Name (acquire) as grasping—land, offering, brother’s life. Type of the way of the flesh (Jude 11).

H8052.meaning: From שָׁמַע (shama), hear, + אֵל (el), God. Samuel = heard of God, or name of God. Prophet and judge (1 Sam 1:20).
H8052.significance: Asked of the Lord; dedicated before birth. Anoints Saul and David; bridge from judges to kingdom. “Speak, for your servant hears” (1 Sam 3:10).

H0452.meaning: From אֵל (el) + יָהּ (Yah). Elijah = my God is YHWH. Prophet (1 Ki 17:1).
H0452.significance: Prophet of fire; confronts Ahab and Baal (1 Ki 18). Type of the forerunner (Mal 4:5; Matt 17:3). Taken up in a whirlwind (2 Ki 2:11); John the Baptist comes in his spirit.

H0477.meaning: From אֵל (el) + יָשַׁע (yasha), save. Elisha = God is salvation. Successor of Elijah (1 Ki 19:16).
H0477.significance: Asks for double portion (2 Ki 2:9); many signs—healing, provision, resurrection. Name (God saves) fits his ministry. Continuation of Elijah’s mantle.

H1840.meaning: From דָּן (dan), judge, + אֵל (el), God. Daniel = God is my judge. Exile prophet (Dan 1:6).
H1840.significance: Interpreter of dreams and visions; faithful in the court of Babylon. Lion’s den (Dan 6); type of the wise one who keeps the law and is vindicated by God.

H0635.meaning: From Persian or Hebrew; possibly “star” (Persian) or “hidden.” Esther = queen in Persia (Est 2:7).
H0635.significance: Jewish queen who risked her life for her people (Est 4:16). “For such a time as this.” Type of providence and the hidden hand of God in exile.

H7342.meaning: From רָחַב (rachav), breadth, wide. Rahab = breadth. Canaanite woman of Jericho (Josh 2:1).
H7342.significance: Hid the spies; spared with her household (Josh 6:25). In the line of Christ (Matt 1:5); type of faith and the inclusion of the nations (Heb 11:31; James 2:25).

H7327.meaning: From רֵעַ (rea), friend, companion. Ruth = friend, companion. Moabitess (Ruth 1:4).
H7327.significance: Covenant loyalty (ḥesed); “your people shall be my people” (Ruth 1:16). Ancestress of David; type of the Gentile bride and the kinsman-redeemer (Boaz).

G2424.meaning: Greek Ἰησοῦς (Iesous); from Hebrew יְהוֹשֻׁעַ (Yehoshua). Jesus = YHWH saves.
G2424.significance: The name given by the angel (Matt 1:21); the name above every name (Phil 2:9). Covenant salvation in person—God with us. No other name under heaven (Acts 4:12).

G5547.meaning: Greek Χριστός (Christos); from χρίω (chrio), anoint. Christ = anointed one.
G5547.significance: Messiah; King and Priest. The anointed of the Lord; fulfills the offices of prophet, priest, and king. Jesus is the Christ (Matt 16:16).

G3323.meaning: Greek Μεσσίας (Messias); from Hebrew מָשִׁיחַ (mashiach), anointed. Messiah = anointed one.
G3323.significance: Hebrew title for the coming King (John 1:41; 4:25). Jesus is the Messiah—the one anointed to redeem and rule.

G2491.meaning: Greek Ἰωάννης (Ioannes); from Hebrew יוֹחָנָן (Yochanan), Yah is gracious. John = Yah is gracious.
G2491.significance: Baptist and apostle; forerunner who points to the Lamb (John 1:29). “He must increase, I must decrease.” Name (gracious) fits the one who announces grace.

G3137.meaning: Greek Μαρία (Maria); from Hebrew מִרְיָם (Miriam). Mary = bitterness or rebellion; possibly “beloved.” Mother of Jesus (Luke 1:30).
G3137.significance: The Lord’s handmaid (Luke 1:38); virgin mother of the Son. At the cross (John 19:25); name and role—the one who bore the Savior.

G4074.meaning: Greek Πέτρος (Petros); from πέτρα (petra), rock. Peter = rock. Apostle (Matt 16:18).
G4074.significance: Cephas; confessor (“You are the Christ”) and foundation of the church. Denied three times, restored three times (John 21). Name (rock) as the one on whom Christ builds.

G3972.meaning: Greek Παῦλος (Paulos); Latin Paulus = small. Apostle (Acts 13:9).
G3972.significance: Apostle to the Gentiles; from persecutor to preacher (Acts 9). “Least of the apostles” (1 Cor 15:9)—name (small) fits his self-understanding and the grace given him.

G2384.meaning: Greek Ἰακώβ (Iakob); from Hebrew Jacob. Jacob = supplanter.
G2384.significance: Patriarch; father of the twelve tribes. NT references to Israel and the covenant promises (Rom 9:13; Heb 11:21).

G2464.meaning: Greek Ἰσαάκ (Isaak); from Hebrew Isaac. Isaac = he laughs.
G2464.significance: Son of promise; type of Christ as the offered son (Heb 11:17–19). Seed through whom the covenant runs (Gal 4:28).

G1138.meaning: Greek Δαυίδ (David); from Hebrew David. David = beloved.
G1138.significance: King; type of Christ (Acts 2:30; Rom 1:3). Son of David—the promised heir to the throne.

G2501.meaning: Greek Ἰωσήφ (Ioseph); from Hebrew Joseph. Joseph = may he add.
G2501.significance: Husband of Mary; earthly father of Jesus (Matt 1:16). Righteous man; obeyed the angel (Matt 2:13–14). Name (add) as the one who did not subtract from the law but fulfilled it.

G2385.meaning: Greek Ἰάκωβος (Iakobos); from Hebrew Jacob. James = supplanter. Multiple: son of Zebedee, son of Alphaeus, brother of the Lord.
G2385.significance: James son of Zebedee: apostle, martyr (Acts 12:2). James brother of the Lord: leader in Jerusalem (Acts 15), author of James. Name in the circle of the Twelve and the family of Jesus.

G2381.meaning: Greek Θωμᾶς (Thomas); Aramaic תְּאוֹמָא (te’oma), twin. Thomas = twin.
G2381.significance: One of the Twelve; “Unless I see…” (John 20:25). Doubting Thomas who confesses “My Lord and my God” (John 20:28). Type of faith that moves from sight to confession.

G0406.meaning: Greek Ἀνδρέας (Andreas); from ἀνήρ (aner), man. Andrew = manly. Apostle (Matt 4:18).
G0406.significance: Brother of Peter; first called with John (John 1:40). Brought Peter to Jesus. Name (manly) as the one who follows and brings others.

G3156.meaning: Greek Μαθθαῖος (Matthaios); from Hebrew מַתִּתְיָהוּ (Mattityahu), gift of Yah. Matthew = gift of Yah. Apostle; tax collector (Matt 9:9).
G3156.significance: Author of the first Gospel; from tax collector to disciple. Name (gift of Yah) as the one given to record the gift of the King.

G3065.meaning: Greek Λουκᾶς (Loukas); from Latin Lucius. Luke = light. Physician; companion of Paul (Col 4:14).
G3065.significance: Author of Luke and Acts; historian of the gospel and the church. “Orderly account” (Luke 1:3); name (light) as the one who brings the light of the narrative.

G2883.meaning: Greek Κορνήλιος (Kornelios); from Latin Cornelius. Cornelius = of a horn. Centurion (Acts 10:1).
G2883.significance: God-fearer; first Gentile to receive the Spirit in Acts (Acts 10:44–48). Type of the opening of the gospel to the nations; name (horn) as strength and salvation (Ps 18:2).

G0912.meaning: From בַּר (bar), son, + אַבָּא (abba), father. Barabbas = son of the father. Prisoner released at Passover (Matt 27:16).
G0912.significance: Insurrectionist and murderer; chosen by the crowd over Jesus (Matt 27:21). Type of the guilty one released while the innocent is condemned—substitution.

G2264.meaning: Greek Ἡρῴδης (Herodes); from Greek hero. Herod = heroic. Dynasty of Idumean kings (Matt 2; Luke 23; Acts 12).
G2264.significance: Herod the Great: slew infants (Matt 2:16). Herod Antipas: beheaded John (Mark 6). Herod Agrippa: persecuted the church (Acts 12). Name (heroic) vs. tyranny—the world’s “hero” against the true King.

G0452.meaning: Greek Ἅννας (Hannas); from Hebrew חָנַן (chanan), gracious. Annas = gracious. High priest (Luke 3:2; John 18:13).
G0452.significance: Former high priest; father-in-law of Caiaphas. Jesus brought before him (John 18:13). Name (gracious) vs. role in the condemnation of the righteous.

G0367.meaning: Greek Ἁνανίας (Ananias); from Hebrew חָנַן (chanan), gracious. Ananias = Yah is gracious. Multiple: disciple in Damascus (Acts 9:10), husband of Sapphira (Acts 5:1).
G0367.significance: Ananias of Damascus: obeyed the Lord and baptized Paul (Acts 9:17). Ananias and Sapphira: lied to the Spirit and fell (Acts 5:5). Same name, opposite fates.

G0625.meaning: Greek Ἀπολλῶς (Apollos); possibly from Apollo. Apollos = from Apollo. Alexandrian Jew (Acts 18:24).
G0625.significance: Eloquent; knew only John’s baptism; instructed by Priscilla and Aquila (Acts 18:26). Fellow worker with Paul (1 Cor 3:6). Name in the service of the word.

G0207.meaning: Latin Aquila = eagle. Husband of Priscilla; tentmaker (Acts 18:2).
G0207.significance: With Priscilla, instructed Apollos (Acts 18:26); greeted by Paul (Rom 16:3). Name (eagle) as one who soars in the word; partner in ministry.

G1050.meaning: Latin Gaius. Gaius = rejoice. Multiple in NT: host (Rom 16:23), Macedonian (Acts 19:29), recipient of 3 John.
G1050.significance: Paul’s host (“host of the whole church” Rom 16:23); one of the few who supported the apostle. Name (rejoice) in the fellowship of the gospel.

G1059.meaning: Greek Γαμαλιήλ (Gamaliel); from Hebrew גְּמַלִּיאֵל (Gamaliel), reward of God. Gamaliel = reward of God. Pharisee; teacher of Paul (Acts 5:34; 22:3).
G1059.significance: Counseled tolerance toward the apostles (Acts 5:34–39); “if it is of God, you cannot overthrow it.” Name (reward of God) as the teacher under whom Paul learned the law.

G1115.meaning: Greek Γολγοθᾶ (Golgotha); from Aramaic גּוּלְגֹּלְתָא (gulgolta), skull. Golgotha = place of the skull.
G1115.significance: Place of crucifixion (Matt 27:33; John 19:17). Name (skull) as the place of death—and of the death that brings life. Calvary (Latin calvaria = skull).

G1068.meaning: Hebrew גַּת־שְׁמָנִים (Gat Shemanim); oil press. Gethsemane = oil press. Garden on the Mount of Olives (Matt 26:36).
G1068.significance: Where Jesus prayed before the arrest; “let this cup pass” (Matt 26:39). Name (oil press) as the place of crushing—the Son pressed in agony, yielding the oil of obedience.

G0963.meaning: Hebrew בֵּית עֲנִיָּה (Beth Aniyah); house of affliction or poor. Bethany = house of the poor/affliction. Village near Jerusalem (Matt 21:17).
G0963.significance: Home of Mary, Martha, Lazarus; where Jesus was anointed (John 12:3); from here he ascended (Luke 24:50). Name (house of affliction) as the place of friendship and anointing before the cross.

G2584.meaning: Hebrew כְּפַר נַחוּם (Kfar Nachum); village of Nahum. Capernaum = village of consolation. Town on the Sea of Galilee (Matt 4:13).
G2584.significance: Jesus’ base in Galilee; many miracles and teachings there. “Exalted to heaven” but brought down (Matt 11:23). Name (consolation) as the place that received the Consoler—and would be judged for unbelief.

G2181.meaning: Greek Ἔφεσος (Ephesos); possibly “permitted.” Ephesus = major city of Asia Minor (Acts 19:1).
G2181.significance: Paul’s long ministry there (Acts 19); one of the seven churches (Rev 2:1). Temple of Artemis; riot (Acts 19:23). Name in the spread of the gospel and the call to repent (Rev 2:5).

G2882.meaning: Greek Κόρινθος (Korinthos). Corinth = city on the isthmus; commercial and cosmopolitan.
G2882.significance: Paul founded the church (Acts 18); wrote 1–2 Corinthians. Faction and immorality; “sanctified in Christ” (1 Cor 1:2) yet in need of correction. Name as the church in the world.

G2332.meaning: Greek Θεσσαλονίκη (Thessalonike); victory over Thessaly. Thessalonica = city in Macedonia.
G2332.significance: Paul preached there (Acts 17:1); received the letters 1–2 Thessalonians. Church of the Thessalonians in God (1 Thess 1:1); name in the apostolic mission.

G0490.meaning: Greek Ἀντιόχεια (Antiocheia); from Antiochus. Antioch = city in Syria (Acts 11:26).
G0490.significance: Where disciples were first called Christians (Acts 11:26). Base for Paul’s missions (Acts 13:1). Name as the birthplace of the name “Christian.”

G0828.meaning: Latin Augustus = revered, majestic. Title of Caesar (Luke 2:1).
G0828.significance: Decree that brought Mary and Joseph to Bethlehem (Luke 2:1)—unwitting servant of the prophecy (Mic 5:2). Name (majestic) as the world’s ruler whose decree fulfills the true King’s birth.

G2958.meaning: Latin Quirinius. Quirinius = governor of Syria (Luke 2:2).
G2958.significance: Registration under his governorship dates the birth of Jesus (Luke 2:2). Name in the intersection of imperial power and the nativity.

G2321.meaning: Greek Θεόφιλος (Theophilus); from θεός (theos), God, + φίλος (philos), friend. Theophilus = friend of God, or loved by God.
G2321.significance: Addressee of Luke and Acts (Luke 1:3; Acts 1:1). Name (loved by God) as the one for whom the orderly account is written—and every reader who seeks certainty.

G3127.meaning: Greek Μαναήν (Manaen); from Hebrew מְנַחֵם (Menachem), comforter. Manaen = comforter. Foster brother of Herod the tetrarch (Acts 13:1).
G3127.significance: Prophet or teacher in Antioch (Acts 13:1); in the circle that sent Paul and Barnabas. Name (comforter) in the ministry of the word.

G2216.meaning: Hebrew זְרֻבָּבֶל (Zerubbabel); from זֶרַע (zera), seed, + בָּבֶל (Babel). Zerubbabel = seed of Babylon. Governor of Judah (Ezra 2:2; Hag 1:1).
G2216.significance: Led the return; laid the foundation of the second temple (Ezra 3:8). In the line of David (Matt 1:12); name (seed of Babylon) as the one who came out of exile to rebuild.

G2199.meaning: Greek Ζεβεδαῖος (Zebedaios); from Hebrew זְבַדְיָה (Zevadyah), Yah has given. Zebedee = Yah has given. Father of James and John (Matt 4:21).
G2199.significance: Fisherman; sons left him to follow Jesus (Matt 4:22). Name (Yah has given) as the one whose sons were given to the gospel—and asked for the right and left hand (Matt 20:21).

G3070.meaning: Greek Λυδία (Lydia); from region Lydia. Lydia = woman of Lydia. Seller of purple (Acts 16:14).
G3070.significance: First European convert (Acts 16:14); “Lord opened her heart.” Hostess at Philippi. Name (from Lydia) as the one through whom the gospel entered Europe.

G3136.meaning: Greek Μάρθα (Martha); Aramaic מַרְתָּא (Marta), lady, mistress. Martha = lady.
G3136.significance: Sister of Mary and Lazarus; “anxious and troubled about many things” (Luke 10:41). Served; confessed “You are the Christ” (John 11:27). Name (lady) as the one who served—and was called to the one thing needful.

G3138.meaning: Greek Μάρκος (Markos); Latin Marcus. Mark = from Mars, or hammer. John Mark (Acts 12:12).
G3138.significance: Companion of Paul and Peter; author of the second Gospel. Deserted (Acts 15:38) but later useful (2 Tim 4:11). Name in the writing of the gospel of the suffering Son.

G2455.meaning: Greek Ἰούδας (Ioudas); from Hebrew Judah. Jude = praise. Author of the letter of Jude (Jude 1).
G2455.significance: Servant of Jesus Christ, brother of James (Jude 1:1). Contends for the faith (Jude 3). Name (praise) as the one who calls the church to persevere.

G1214.meaning: Greek Δημᾶς (Demas); possibly short for Demetrius. Demas = companion of Paul (Col 4:14).
G1214.significance: Once with Paul (Phlm 24); later “in love with this present world” (2 Tim 4:10). Name as the one who turned away—warning against apostasy.

G0708.meaning: Greek Ἀρίσταρχος (Aristarchos); from ἄριστος (aristos), best, + ἀρχή (arche), ruler. Aristarchus = best ruler. Macedonian (Acts 19:29).
G0708.significance: Traveled with Paul (Acts 20:4); with him in the riot at Ephesus and on the voyage to Rome. “Fellow prisoner” (Col 4:10). Name (best ruler) as the one who served the apostle.

G2037.meaning: Greek Ἔραστος (Erastus); from ἐραστός (erastos), beloved. Erastus = beloved. City treasurer (Rom 16:23).
G2037.significance: One of Paul’s helpers (Acts 19:22); “city treasurer” in Corinth (Rom 16:23). Name (beloved) in the list of those who served the church.

G2921.meaning: Greek Κρίσπος (Krispos); from Latin Crispus. Crispus = curled. Ruler of the synagogue (Acts 18:8).
G2921.significance: Believed with his household (Acts 18:8); Paul baptized him (1 Cor 1:14). Name (curled) as the one who turned from synagogue to Christ.

G2383.meaning: Greek Ἰάειρος (Iaeiros); from Hebrew יָאִיר (Yair), he will enlighten. Jairus = he will enlighten. Ruler of the synagogue (Mark 5:22).
G2383.significance: Begged Jesus to heal his daughter (Mark 5:23); daughter raised (Mark 5:42). Name (he will enlighten) as the one whose house was enlightened by the resurrection.

G3124.meaning: Greek Μάλχος (Malchos); from Hebrew מֶלֶךְ (melek), king. Malchus = king. Servant of the high priest (John 18:10).
G3124.significance: Ear cut off by Peter; healed by Jesus (Luke 22:51). Name (king) as the servant of the high priest—and the one who received mercy from the true King.

G2582.meaning: Greek Κανδάκη (Kandake); title of Ethiopian queen. Candace = queen of the Ethiopians (Acts 8:27).
G2582.significance: Her eunuch was reading Isaiah and was baptized by Philip (Acts 8:27–38). Name (title) as the power from whose court the gospel reached the ends (Acts 1:8).

G0959.meaning: Greek Βερνίκη (Bernike); from Greek, bringer of victory. Bernice = bringer of victory. Sister of Agrippa II (Acts 25:13).
G0959.significance: Present with Agrippa when Paul made his defense (Acts 25:23). Name (victory) as the one who heard the gospel in the royal court—and did not believe.

G1409.meaning: Greek Δρούσιλλα (Drousilla); from Latin Drusilla. Drusilla = wife of Felix (Acts 24:24).
G1409.significance: Jewish wife of the Roman governor; with Felix heard Paul speak of righteousness and judgment (Acts 24:25). Felix was afraid—but did not repent.

G0986.meaning: Greek Βλάστος (Blastos); from βλαστός (blastos), bud. Blastus = chamberlain of Herod (Acts 12:20).
G0986.significance: Mediated between Tyre and Sidon and Herod (Acts 12:20). Name (bud) as the one in the court when Herod was struck (Acts 12:23)—the king’s servant and the King’s judgment.

G0249.meaning: Greek Ἐλισάβετ (Elisabet); from Hebrew אֱלִישֶׁבַע (Elisheva), my God is oath. Elizabeth = my God is oath. Mother of John the Baptist (Luke 1:5).
G0249.significance: Wife of Zechariah; relative of Mary; “blessed is she who believed” (Luke 1:45). Name (God is oath) as the one who bore the forerunner—the oath fulfilled.

G2197.meaning: Greek Ζαχαρίας (Zacharias); from Hebrew זְכַרְיָה (Zechariah), Yah has remembered. Zechariah = Yah has remembered. Father of John the Baptist (Luke 1:5).
G2197.significance: Priest; struck mute until John’s birth (Luke 1:20, 64). Sang the Benedictus (Luke 1:68–79). Name (Yah has remembered) as the one who announced the dawn from on high.

G2489.meaning: Greek Ἰωάννα (Ioanna); from Hebrew יוֹחָנָן (Yochanan). Joanna = Yah is gracious. Wife of Chuza (Luke 8:3).
G2489.significance: Among the women who supported Jesus and the Twelve (Luke 8:3); at the empty tomb (Luke 24:10). Name (gracious) as the one who received and proclaimed grace.

G2131.meaning: Greek Εὐνίκη (Eunike); from εὐ (eu), good, + νίκη (nike), victory. Eunice = good victory. Mother of Timothy (2 Tim 1:5).
G2131.significance: Jewish mother; faith that dwelt in her and in Lois (2 Tim 1:5). Name (good victory) as the one who passed the faith to Timothy.

G3090.meaning: Greek Λωΐς (Lois); possibly from λωΐον (loion), better. Lois = grandmother of Timothy (2 Tim 1:5).
G3090.significance: Faith that dwelt in Lois and Eunice (2 Tim 1:5). Name in the line of faith—grandmother to Timothy, servant of the gospel.

G0451.meaning: Greek Ἄννα (Anna); from Hebrew חַנָּה (Hannah), grace. Anna = grace. Prophetess (Luke 2:36).
G0451.significance: Widow; in the temple when Jesus was presented (Luke 2:36–38). Spoke of him to all who were waiting. Name (grace) as the one who recognized the redemption of Jerusalem.

G3003.meaning: Latin Legio. Legion = Roman military unit; name of the demons in the Gerasene (Mark 5:9).
G3003.significance: “My name is Legion; for we are many” (Mark 5:9). The multitude of evil; cast into the pigs. Name as the confession of the unclean spirit before the Son of God.

G2394.meaning: Greek Ἰάσων (Iason); from Greek ἰάομαι (iaomai), heal. Jason = healer. Host of Paul in Thessalonica (Acts 17:5).
G2394.significance: Paul and Silas stayed with him (Acts 17:7); dragged before the authorities (Acts 17:6). Name (healer) as the one who received the apostles—and bore the cost.

G0711.meaning: Greek Ἀριστόβουλος (Aristoboulos); from ἄριστος (aristos), best, + βουλή (boule), counsel. Aristobulus = best counsel. In Rome (Rom 16:10).
G0711.significance: Household greeted by Paul (Rom 16:10). Name (best counsel) in the list of the saints in the capital.
